task_description: Facing the building to your South-East (approx. 140°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I am currently facing the target building at 141°SE; to estimate its height, I need to look upward to see the full structure from base to roof.
I have rotated upward but am no longer facing the target building; I need to rotate horizontally back to ~140°SE to align with the building before estimating height.
I am now correctly facing the target building at 140°SE; I will look upward to capture the full vertical extent from ground to roof for height estimation.
I have lost alignment with the target building after rotating up; I must reorient horizontally to 140°SE while maintaining upward pitch to see the full height.

I am now facing the target building at 140°SE with a 30° upward pitch, which allows me to see its full vertical structure; based on visual scaling and typical building proportions, I estimate its height to be approximately 24 meters.
